p: Given the wealth of epidemiological data emerging from multiple sources, a group at the Harvard Center for Communicable Disease Dynamics identified key unanswered questions [ 6]. Among the most important questions are the incubation period and the reproduction number. Estimates of the incubation period vary with a median around 5 days, but a period of 14 days or more has been reported [ 7–9]. Another key measure is the serial interval between consecutive cases, estimated as just under 5 days [ 10]. The other measure of transmission closely watched is the reproduction number; the number of secondary cases arising after transmission from an index case. In the early stages of the pandemic this was estimated at 2.9 [ 11].
